thread.title: U2 Sued For $5 Million For Ripping Off 'Achtung Baby' Track 'The Fly' [News]
thread.title_full: U2 Sued For $5 Million For Ripping Off 'Achtung Baby' Track 'The Fly' [News]

title: U2 Sued For $5 Million For Ripping Off 'Achtung Baby' Track 'The Fly' [News]
text:
U2 Sued for $5 Million for Ripping Off 'Achtung Baby' Track 'The Fly' The song they allegedly plagiarized is Paul Rose's "Nae Slappin'." Posted 13 hours ago 2 
U2 have received a lawsuit from Paul Rose, seeking $5 million for plagiarizing his 1989 song "Nae Slappin'" on " The Fly " - the lead single off the band's classic 1991 album " Achtung Baby ." 
The lawsuit is accusing the Irish rockers of hearing Paul's song in an Island Records studio executive office back in 1989, right after signing a deal the label. Rose says the U2 guys were in pursuit of a new sound, listening to new music, including his own. 
The lawsuit reads: "Although perhaps the most popular rock band in the world in the 1980s, by that decade's end the band felt in need of reinvigoration." 
A report from NY Post reads: "Rose's lawyer, Thomas Mullaney, said his client is only coming forward now - some 26 years later - because he was just starting out at the time of the alleged theft and he didn't want it to ruin his career. 
"Rose also only recently found an ex-Island Records employee who will corroborate his story, including that 'Nae Slappin' was often played at Island records when U2 was looking for inspiration of 'Achtung Baby,' Mullaney said." 
You can take a listen to the two tunes below.
